data.text: @SaludAmerica @FacesOfCOVID @juliaoftoronto @AP_OD_National @NeighborhoodHth @HealthBegins @ASTHO @AVANCEinc @ImmJusticeNOW @RAICESTEXAS @CHIRLA COVID19, has really brought to light barriers to health in minority groups. Truly equity focused decision making is the key to equitable access, so everyone may attain their full health potential. Regardless of race.

@SaludAmerica @FacesOfCOVID @juliaoftoronto @AP_OD_National @NeighborhoodHth @HealthBegins @ASTHO @AVANCEinc @ImmJusticeNOW @RAICESTEXAS @CHIRLA An equitable respond should have been to have systems in place to offer different points of entry to services in different languages. Working from the beginning with CO that knew their communities and were trusted messengers.

@_ACLAMO_ @FacesOfCOVID @juliaoftoronto @AP_OD_National @NeighborhoodHth @HealthBegins @ASTHO @AVANCEinc @ImmJusticeNOW @RAICESTEXAS @CHIRLA This is a great thought -- please tag with #saludtues to share with the whole group!

@SaludAmerica @FacesOfCOVID @juliaoftoronto @AP_OD_National @NeighborhoodHth @HealthBegins @ASTHO @AVANCEinc @ImmJusticeNOW @RAICESTEXAS @CHIRLA Testing and clinics were set up in places outside of the heart of the community. Transportation and communication were a barrier to access! No interpreters available. Information was given only in English. Took too long to catch up!
